sentences.sContent: Finally, we had extraterritoriality and used this legal advantage in order to be extremely active in the opium trade.
sentences.sContent_eng: Finally, we had extraterritoriality and used this legal advantage in order to be extremely active in the opium trade.
sentences.sCn: 最后，我们有治外法权，并利用这一法律的好处，以极为活跃在鸦片贸易。

sentences.sContent: This i. e. , if in fight or being in charge of quarters period, the crime American serviceman enjoys the extraterritoriality .
sentences.sContent_eng: This i. e. , if in fight or being in charge of quarters period, the crime American serviceman enjoys the extraterritoriality .
sentences.sCn: 这也就是说，如果是在战斗或值勤期间，犯罪的美国军人还是享有治外法权。

sentences.sContent: Japan was the first Asian country to modernize on its own terms, outside of colonial or semi-colonial control, or even, after 1895, extraterritoriality.
sentences.sContent_eng: Japan was the first Asian country to modernize on its own terms, outside of colonial or semi-colonial control, or even, after 1895, extraterritoriality.
sentences.sCn: 日本是亚洲第一个现代化的国家就其本身来说，远离殖民地或半殖民地的控制之苦，甚至，1895年以后，治外法权。

trans.tranOther: the privilege granted to some aliens, esp diplomats, of being exempt from the jurisdiction of the state in which they reside
